snippet: Experts predict separate caps for gas-fired and coal-burning plants, something the coal industry would be likely to challenge.
abstract: Environmental Protection Agency plans to propose first-ever limits on greenhouse gas emissions from newly built power plants; details of proposal remain confidential but experts predict it will include separate standards for carbon dioxide emissions from plants fired by natural gas and by coal.
lead_paragraph: Experts predict separate caps for gas-fired and coal-burning plants, something the coal industry would be likely to challenge.

headline.main: E.P.A. Is Expected to Set Limits on Greenhouse Gas Emissions by New Power Plants
headline.print_headline: E.P.A. Is Expected to Set Limits on Greenhouse Gas Emissions by New Power Plants
